reasoning: Primary Ovarian Insufficiency (POI) is a chronic condition best measured by prevalence rather than incidence. Affects approximately 1% of women under 40 (1,000 per 100k women). Data from epidemiological studies, though not 2005-specific.
source: Coulam CB et al. (1986). Incidence of premature ovarian failure. Obstet Gynecol. 67(4):604-606
